TextSection.Contents: Secondary pulmonary hemosiderosis is a respiratory disease due to the deposition of hemosiderin-laden macrophages in lungs as a result of repeated alveolar hemorrhage secondary to another disease especially dysimmunitary disorders (i.e. Heiner syndrome autoimmune diseases) thrombotic disorders and cardiovascular disorders such as mitral stenosis. It manifests as a triad of hemoptysis anemia and diffuse parenchymal infiltrates on chest radiography

Parent.Label: Secondary interstitial lung disease in childhood and adulthood
